error.description: The master station has received an unexpected response from the CCU.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error associated with a logic problem internal to the CCU or possibly an echo on the communication channel.
Attempt the command again
From Commander, remotely reset the CCU and attempt the command again
If the problem persists, contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station has received an invalid response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error associated with the number of data packets received for a single communication. This error code is returned when the CCU receives too many or too few packets based on the request.
Attempt the command again
If the problem persists, contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: Checksum verification failed on communication between the master station and the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error typically associated with systems using direct radio communications between the master station and a targeted device such as a CCU, RTU or dial up meter. Communication timing setup usually plays a role in troubleshooting this problem.
Attempt the command again
Using Commander, attempt a loop or scan on the targeted device to verify communications
If the loop or scan is successful,
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below). If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258.
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab
If the loopback is not successful
Attempt to loop or scan another device using the same communications channel
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU address in the response does not match the address of the targeted CCU.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is commonly due to timing or buffering problems with communication equipment such as portservers or radios.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with a setup problem or possibly caused by a communications equipment failure
Attempt the command again
Attempt a loop or scan of another device using the same communications channel if available
If communication to the second device is successful, the error is probably caused by an equipment or setup problem with the original device.
Verify the targeted device's serial number and/or address
Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the targeted device is working properly
If the communication to the second device is not successful, the error is probably caused by an equipment problem at the master station
Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the master station is working properly
If the targeted device is a CCU, verify it is powered up and the selector is not switched to external
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.porter: Sequence Reject Frame Received... Sequencing Ajusted
error.description: The response's sequence number does not match what was expected by the master station.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with invalid timing parameter's set at the master station. Another possible cause is a field visit to the CCU resulting in local communications being used. Upon setting the communcations back to internal, the master station may receive this error on the first request due internal bookkeeping mismatches. The master station will automatically recovery from this internal mismatch.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station received an invalid header in the response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with invalid timing parameters set at the master station. This particular code is returned when the first section of the response from the targeted device does not match what the master station was expecting.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: Checksum verifcation failed on response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error caused by an incomplete or corrupted response.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU did not respond correctly to a reset request.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error associated with a logic problem internal to the CCU.
Attempt the command again
If the problem persists, contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU has rejected a request from the master station.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error often caused by a mismatch of bookkeeping between the master station and the CCU. Another possibility is a logic problem internal to the CCU.
Attempt the command again
From Commander, remotely reset the CCU and attempt the command again
If the problem persists, it may be due to a faulty logic card in the CCU. Replace the logic card or contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The repeater did not receive a response from the end device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station timed out while waiting for carrier detect on the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with equipment failure or improperly configured communication channels
Attempt the command again
Verify carrier detect is necessary for this communication channel
If carrier detect is not necessary for this communication channel
Verify "Carrier Detect Wait" is unchecked on the communication channel
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
"Carrier Detect Wait" checkbox on the General tab
Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the master station is working properly
If the targeted device is a CCU, verify it is powered up and the selector is not switched to external
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station was unable to read from the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or retrieve data from the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
If using a port server or terminal server, verify connectivity to the device containing the physical communication ports
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station was unable to write to the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or write data to the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
If using a port server or terminal server, verify connectivity to the device containing the physical communication ports
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.porter: DLC Read Timeout on CCU Queue Entry
error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device on a queued request.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.porter: Route Failed on CCU Queue Entry
error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device on a queued request.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station was unable to communicate with the targeted device due to communication failure.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error typically associated with a failure to initialize the modem for dialup.
Attempt the command again
Verify the modem is functioning properly
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The CCU heard a response from a device other than the one it was targeting.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated either crosstalk or is preceeded by a bulk communication error such as a timeout.
Attempt the command again
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station was unable to connect to the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is associated with the inability to connect to or initialize the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station was unable to write to the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or send data to the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The master station was unable to read from the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to retrieve data from the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.porter: Address Does Not Match Expected Value
error.description: The CCU heard a response from a device other than the one it was targeting.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated either crosstalk or is preceeded by a bulk communication error such as a timeout.
Attempt the command again
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: The powerline carrier device was unable to communicate to the connected IED.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is associated with using a powerline carrier device to query data from another intelligent device on the line. The error is returned when the carrier device is unable to communicate with the polyphase meter or other end device.
Attempt the command again
If possible, verify the phyisical connection between the carrier device and the IED
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: Checksum verification failed on the response from the end device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt the command on the original device and verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation
If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258

error.description: Troubleshooting tips for this error code are not available at this time
error.troubleshooting: If the problem persists, please contact Technical Support at 1-800-815-2258
